Leonard TanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 08 Mar 2019Levered ETFs- ETFs which comprise of derivatives to increase exposure to underlying tracked index. Pretty interesting idea in my opinion- but I think investors need to be aware this carries much higher exposure and therefore market risk.
Just read a pretty interesting article over in mid 2017 when the SEC went back against approving an ETF set to replicate over 4x of the S&P index. Quite a good move considering newer ETFs as such were just going to get increasing levered which would ultimately hit people harder during a recession.
